metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Comments can be used to explain C# code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to prevent execution when testing alternative code.
content.html: Comments can be used to explain C# code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to prevent execution when testing alternative code.

content.text: Single-line comments start with two forward slashes ( // ).
content.html: Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (//).

content.text: Any text between // and the end of the line is ignored by C# (will not be executed).
content.html: Any text between // and the end of the line is ignored by C# (will not be executed).

content.text: This example uses a single-line comment before a line of code:
content.html: This example uses a single-line comment before a line of code:

content.code_html:
// This is a comment
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");

content.text: This example uses a single-line comment at the end of a line of code:
content.html: This example uses a single-line comment at the end of a line of code:

content.code_html: Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");  // This is a comment

content.text: Multi-line comments start with /* and ends with */ .
content.html: Multi-line comments start with /* and ends with */.

content.text: Any text between /* and */ will be ignored by C#.
content.html: Any text between /* and */ will be ignored by C#.

content.text: This example uses a multi-line comment (a comment block) to explain the code:
content.html: This example uses a multi-line comment (a comment block) to explain the code:

content.code_html:
/* The code below will print the words Hello World
to the screen, and it is amazing */
Console.WriteLine("Hello World!");

content.text: It is up to you which you want to use. Normally, we use // for short comments, and /* */ for longer.
content.html: It is up to you which you want to use. Normally, we use // for short comments, and /* */ for longer.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What symbol is used to start a single-line comment in C#?
content.html: What symbol is used to start a single-line comment in C#?
